detail.title: The Imperative of Blockchain Education for Nigerian Legal Professionals
detail.abstract:
The concepts of cryptocurrency, web3 and blockchain technology have gained significant regulatory attention globally, evident in the emergence of prudential regulatory frameworks(e.g, MiCA), in crypto-based lawsuits, in the evolution of new areas of legal practice, and through the policy pronouncements of international organizations including the Financial Action Task Force (FATF), World Bank, International Monetary Fund (IMF), and The Financial Stability Board (FSB). In addition, the varied approaches to the regulation of cryptocurrencies across the world have become a significant area of ongoing legal research and development, giving rise to the establishment of reputable academic centres like the Cambridge Centre for Alternative Finance, the Stanford Blockchain Research Centre, and UCL’s Centre for Blockchain Technologies(CBT).

This paper makes a compelling case for the introduction of a blockchain-oriented curriculum to be taught in Nigerian universities and law schools. It has become expedient for The Council of Legal Education to recognize the relevance of blockchain education in the evolving global regulatory landscape. With the Investment Securities Act(ISA) of 2025 and the Accelerated Regulatory Incubation Program(ARIP) forming the core of Nigeria’s crypto framework under the purview of the Securities Exchange of Commission(SEC), the imperative to equip legal professionals with specialized knowledge in this domain cannot be overstated.

AI.tldr: 本文主张在尼日利亚的大学和法学院引入区块链相关课程，以适应全球监管环境的变化，并强调法律专业人士在此领域的专业知识需求。

AI.motivation: 全球范围内对加密货币、Web3和区块链技术的监管日益重视，尼日利亚的法律教育体系需要适应这一趋势，培养具备相关知识的法律专业人士。

AI.method: 通过分析全球监管趋势和尼日利亚的法律框架，提出区块链课程的引入方案。
AI.findings: 区块链教育对尼日利亚法律专业人士至关重要，有助于应对加密货币和区块链技术的监管挑战。

AI.practical_contributions: 为尼日利亚的大学和法学院提供了具体的课程设计建议，助力法律专业人士适应全球监管环境。

title: Standards and responsible innovation for self-driving vehicles
affiliations: University College London and University of York

detail.title: Standards and responsible innovation for self-driving vehicles

declarations.declarationOfInterest: Both authors carried out this work as consultants for the UK Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation
declarations.funderStatement: This research was funded by the Economic and Social Research Council (ES/S001832/1) the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EP/Y009800/1) The Lloyd's Register Foundation and the UK Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation

detail.abstract: The introduction of self-driving vehicles (SDVs) onto public roads raises important social, ethical and engineering questions to do with standards for acceptable risk, privacy, fairness, transparency and governance. In this paper, we describe an approach to establishing standards and regulations for the technology, developed for a policy report we co-authored on 'Responsible innovation in self-driving vehicles'. This report was requested by the UK Government to support the process that led to the UK's Automated Vehicles (AV) Act 2024. Our approach widens the scope of regulation and standards-setting to aim for high levels of fairness as well as safety. We call our approach 'REAP' (Relational, Equitable, Adaptive and Participatory). We explain how what engineers call a Concept of Operations (ConOps) can be adapted to reflect the REAP approach. From our standpoints in social science and engineering, we outline our reasoning and highlight some of the recommendations made to the UK Government. We consider how this approach could be used to improve the standards that are and will be instrumental in the engineering and regulation of SDVs. Given the immaturity and uncertainties of SDV technologies, our hope is that our recommendations inform good governance, first through the development of goal-based standards and then in the definition of any future prescriptive regulations.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为REAP（关系性、公平性、适应性和参与性）的方法，用于制定自动驾驶车辆的标准和法规，旨在提高公平性和安全性。
AI.research_question: 如何制定自动驾驶车辆的标准和法规，以确保公平性和安全性？

AI.theoretical_framework: REAP方法（关系性、公平性、适应性和参与性）及工程中的操作概念（ConOps）。
AI.method: 结合社会科学和工程学的视角，提出REAP方法，并解释如何将其应用于操作概念（ConOps）。

AI.practical_contributions: 为英国政府的自动驾驶车辆法规（AV Act 2024）提供了建议，支持良好的治理和技术发展。

title: A tug of war across the market: overnight-vs-daytime lead-lag networks and clustering-based portfolio strategies
affiliations: University of Oxford - Department of Statistics, University of Oxford - Department of Statistics, University of Oxford and University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) - Department of Mathematics

detail.title: A tug of war across the market: overnight-vs-daytime lead-lag networks and clustering-based portfolio strategies
detail.abstract: In this research, we show that the tug of war is not only at individual stock level but also a networked trading behaviour across the entire market. By decomposing daily returns into overnight and daytime components, we construct directed networks to capture the lead-lag relations between overnight speculations and daytime price corrections, and vice versa, across stocks. We originate a novel clustering-based framework to construct portfolios to capture the cross-stock tug of war. In order to identify disjoint leader and lagger groups in directed lead-lag networks, we develop a specialized spectral clustering algorithm. By generating trading signals exclusively from the leader stocks to predict and trade lagger stocks, we isolate pure cross-stock interactions from autocorrelation within individual stocks. Our empirical results support the conclusion that both noise traders and arbitrageurs trade at the portfolio level and disseminate the tug of war across stocks. With backtests spanning from 2000-01-03 to 2024-12-31, the cross-stock lead-lag portfolios generate remarkable returns and significant alphas on top of portfolio representing firm-level tug-of-war reversals and other the pricing factors. Moreover, the performance of cross-stock lead-lag portfolios grow in recent years, while the stock-specific reversals decay.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过分解每日收益为隔夜和日间部分，构建有向网络捕捉股票间的领先-滞后关系，并提出基于聚类的投资组合框架。研究发现噪声交易者和套利者在投资组合层面交易，并通过回测验证了跨股票领先-滞后组合的显著收益。

title: Top Down Stress Testing for Bank Financial Statements: A Case Study
affiliations: Risk Control Limited

detail.title: Top Down Stress Testing for Bank Financial Statements: A Case Study
detail.abstract:
This note shows through a case study how Risk Control’s Stress ControllerTM software may be used to implement top down stress testing of a bank. The calculations are based on the publicly available financial statement and Pillar 3 disclosures of a large UK bank.

We show how the balance sheet, P&L and key financial ratios are affected by scenarios involving recessions in America, Europe and the UK. A set of equations is constructed to describe the evolution of the bank’s financial statements.

Changes in the credit quality of the bank’s loan book and fluctuations in the value of mark-to-market exposures affect asset values and income through provisions and mark-to-market asset write-offs. For a base case and for each of the stress scenarios, predictions are supplied for the bank’s key variables.

The results show how the bank’s impairment provisions rise, and capital, asset growth, returns on equity and profitability are depressed by the different recession scenarios. A UK-based recession has a larger impact than the other recession scenarios but shows a more rapid recovery.

Note that the framework used here may be used either with coarse, public data to perform top down stress testing or with highly granular internal bank data for bottom-up stress testing purposes. The financial statement modeling is highly flexible since equations may be written first in Excel, converted into scripts and then imported into the software for use at run-time to perform calculations.

AI.tldr: 本文通过案例研究展示了如何使用Risk Control的Stress ControllerTM软件对银行进行自上而下的压力测试，基于一家大型英国银行的公开财务报表和Pillar 3披露数据。

title: The EBA’s Proposed Capital Rules for Qualifying Securitisations
affiliations: Risk Control Limited

detail.title: The EBA’s Proposed Capital Rules for Qualifying Securitisations
detail.abstract:
The European Banking Authority (EBA) has published proposals for a ‘rescaling’ or reduction in regulatory capital risk weights for securitisations that may be categorised as Simple, Standard and Transparent (SST) and that satisfy certain pool credit risk requirements (see EBA (2015)). The proposals suggest (a) adjustments in parameters of the formulae-based approaches contained in BCBS 303, (b) changes in the look-up table for the BCBS 303 ratings based approach and (c) lowered risk-weight floors for senior tranches.

The EBA’s proposed re-calibration is reasonably effective in the case of the formulae-based approaches. As we explain in this note, however, a combination of BCBS 303 rules, supervisory practices and ratings agencies’ views of European deals mean that the positive effect on securitisation activity in Europe is likely to be slight. This is because, under proposed rules, capital for the large majority of European banks’ securitisation positions would be based on a very conservative ratings based approach.

(BCBS 303 suggests that a top-down purchased-receivables treatment may facilitate broader use of non ratings based approaches. But, the general industry view is that CRR rules and supervisory practices will preclude widespread use of a purchased receivable treatment so heavy reliance on ratings based capital calculation in Europe will remain.)

Obvious and simple changes in the rules involving a reduction in the reliance on ratings of the securitisation capital framework would transform the situation. These changes are spelt out in the conclusion to our note.

In brief, unless the European authorities take action beyond what is currently proposed by EBA (2015) (reducing reliance on ratings or drastically modifying the current ratings based rules), volumes of placed deals will remain small, securitisation issuance will be the preserve of small to medium-sized banks with little access to alternative funding, and the market will have to rely on US institutions as the main investors.

title: A Journey into Harold Hotelling's Economics
affiliations: University of Lyon 2, CNRS, CIRED and Université Côte d’Azur

detail.title: A Journey into Harold Hotelling's Economics

publicationDetails.detailsText: Journal of Economic Literature, volume 62, issue 3, 2024[10.1257/jel.20231700]

detail.abstract: Harold Hotelling (1895–1973) was a major contributor to twentieth-century American economics. The overall thrust of his research, and his view of the role of mathematics in the discipline, have so far received little attention. Based on an unprecedented examination of his work and professional archives, this article provides a thorough analysis of Hotelling's background and contribution to economics. A self-taught economist in the 1920s, Hotelling built a research program that, despite apparently being highly technical, was primarily conceived as applied science to solve concrete social and economic issues, from spatial competition to natural resource exhaustion and public utility regulation. Although Hotelling's research was not exempt from criticism, it remains profoundly inspiring for the twenty-first century, from both a theoretical and epistemological point of view. When we remember that he trained the greatest, from Kenneth J. Arrow to William Vickrey, his career and ideas are all the more worthy of consideration.

AI.tldr: 本文通过对Harold Hotelling的工作和专业档案的全面分析，探讨了他对经济学的背景和贡献。Hotelling的研究虽然技术性强，但旨在解决具体的社会经济问题，如空间竞争和自然资源枯竭。他的研究对21世纪仍有深远启发。
AI.research_question: Harold Hotelling的研究背景及其对经济学的贡献是什么？
AI.motivation: Hotelling作为20世纪美国经济学的重要贡献者，其研究方法和数学在经济学中的应用尚未得到充分关注。
AI.theoretical_framework: Hotelling的研究基于应用科学，旨在解决社会经济问题，如空间竞争和自然资源管理。
AI.method: 通过对Hotelling的工作和专业档案的深入分析。
AI.findings: Hotelling的研究虽然技术性强，但具有实际应用价值，对现代经济学仍有重要启发。
AI.theory_contributions: 为经济学提供了应用科学的研究框架，尤其是在空间竞争和资源管理领域。
AI.practical_contributions: 为解决具体社会经济问题提供了理论支持，如公共事业监管和自然资源保护。

title: Do More Open Economies Lead to Export Concentration? The Case of Selected Agribusiness Goods in Brazilian Municipalities
affiliations: FEA-USP and Federal University of Viçosa

detail.title: Do More Open Economies Lead to Export Concentration? The Case of Selected Agribusiness Goods in Brazilian Municipalities

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare no conflict of interest.
declarations.funderStatement: This research contains no public or private funding.

detail.abstract: This paper aims to characterize an important question: does a more export-open economy for a municipality imply a larger export concentration in terms of goods exported? Recent developments in export imputation for Brazilian municipalities allow for an analysis of the concentration profile of each municipality and its relationship with export openness. Our research makes three major contributions: we develop a novel Export-Intensive Gini Index using Monte Carlo simulations that isolates commodityspecific concentration patterns while controlling for the composition of remaining export portfolios; we apply double machine learning methodology to establish causal relationships while controlling for hundreds of municipal characteristics including geographic, infrastructural, demographic, and institutional factors; we provide the first comprehensive analysis of subnational export concentration patterns in a major developing economy using production-based rather than customs-based trade data. Our results reveal heterogeneity across commodities: coffee exhibits the strongest positive relationship between export openness and concentration, followed by corn, soybeans and sugar, while beef demonstrates negative coefficient. These findings indicate that trade integration affects agricultural specialization differently across commodities, with implications for regional economic vulnerability and policy design. For policymakers, our results suggest that coffee and corn-producing municipalities face increasing exposure to price volatility as they integrate into global markets, requiring targeted risk mitigation strategies. Conversely, the weak relationships for soybeans and beef suggest these sectors may offer more stable foundations for export-oriented development.

detail.abstract: This note describes how the Swiss National Bank has adapted its monetary policy implementation in the money market since 2015, across periods of negative, positive and zero policy rates. All three periods have been characterised by an environment with abundant sight deposits, i.e. banks have held considerably more sight deposits at the SNB than they need to settle payments or meet reserve requirements. In this context, remunerating sight deposits at the SNB policy rate has enabled the effective steering of money market interest rates, while applying different rates of interest to different portions of sight deposits - known as tiered remuneration - has supported money market activity.

detail.abstract: Regulatory capital is the primary constraint on banks' strategic decision making in the current regulatory environment. This note shows how banks may use top down analysis of their assets to optimise the Return on Regulatory Capital (RORC). We analyse the loan book of a major international bank using publicly available Pillar 3 data and show that a shift from corporate to retail lending would significantly boost the bank's RORC. The calculations are performed within Risk Control's financial planning software, Stress Controller TM .

detail.abstract: This book addresses the increasingly important topic of climate security and international norm-making by documenting and analysing the intensifying dialogue between evolving discourses of global security and climate change governance. It is guided by the core argument that climate risk is a central aspect of climate security, as reflected in climate security statements by the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the European Union (EU), and the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). It presents a comparative assessment of the extent to which policy statements and debates on climate risk and climate security within these interstate institutions might indicate an emerging dominant discourse on climate security, as well as how these institutions have understood, conceptualised and recognised climate security. This book, which includes scoping interviews with leading climate security experts, examines the literature on epistemic communities, riskification, and securitisation in order to conceptualise three analytical themes as a set of tools relevant for analysing the nuances of climate and security discourses. It applies these themes to the domain of interstate climate security, highlighting important contrasts between the themes while recognising conceptual overlaps and interchange between them. In doing so, it demonstrates and broadens awareness of how the themes can be used.

title: Assessing State Resilience: Lynching and its Ramifications on State Credit in the US
affiliations: Troy University -- Department of Economics, Finance, & RMI and Troy University

detail.title: Assessing State Resilience: Lynching and its Ramifications on State Credit in the US
detail.abstract: The importance of state capacity and institutional quality has received significant attention within the academic literature. This is especially true as it relates to the protection of property rights and, ultimately, the role it plays in economic development. This study adds to this literature by considering how lynching activity across US states impacts sovereign credit. Given that lynching tends to be associated with weak public sector institutions, limited-access social orders, and the weak protection of individual and property rights, we posit that as lynchings increase so too will bond yields. The analysis covers the period 1883-1920 and find support that state borrowing costs rose as lynching activity increased. The results are robust to a number of specifications, demographic groups, and regions. Implications are discussed.

detail.abstract:
The article analyses the historical conditions for the formation and development of alternative (non-military) service in Armenia, as well as the current legislative mechanisms and practical experience of its application. The authors describe the history of the emergence and development of the institute of alternative service in Armenia. Particular attention is paid to the influence of state institutions and religious organisations on the decision to refuse military service on grounds of conscience, as well as to the specifics of the activities of various religious organisations under martial law. The authors reveal the role of the Armenian Apostolic Church as the national church and demonstrate how the freedom of activity of other religious organisations registered in Armenia is ensured. The authors emphasise the significant impact of the decisions of international judicial institutions whose jurisdiction is recognised by Armenia, as well as the conclusions of international human rights organisations on the development of the institute of alternative service in this country.

Based on Armenia's experience, the authors offer a number of recommendations for Ukraine seeking to improve its national egislation on alternative (non-military) service. Based on the results of a detailed analysis of the peculiarities of the procedure for performing two different forms of alternative service (alternative military service and alternative labour service) in Armenia, the authors show that this approach allows for a more complete consideration of the interests of both the state and citizens who have religious beliefs incompatible with traditional military service.

The authors conclude that it is possible to amend the legislation of Ukraine on alternative (non-military) service to introduce several types of alternative service for different categories of citizens depending on the specifics of their religious beliefs. This is extremely relevant for Ukraine, given the Russian-Ukrainian war. The institutional expansion of the range of forms for the Motherland’s defence can significantly strengthen the defence capability of the state and at the same time guarantee the exercise of everyone's right to freedom of conscience and religion.

title: On Production Subsidies and Import Tariffs under Uncertainty

detail.title: On Production Subsidies and Import Tariffs under Uncertainty
detail.abstract: This paper examines the welfare consequences of production subsidies and import tariffs in a differentiated Cournot duopoly under market demand uncertainty. Utilizing the import-competing framework, we show that the first best policy combines production subsidies and import tariffs. When the domestic government is limited to using only one policy instrument, the superiority of production subsidies over import tariffs depends on the international cost disparity between domestic and foreign firms. Moreover, Laissez-faire yields the lowest expected social welfare for the domestic country. Our results on policy rankings hold regardless of market volatility or the degree of product differentiation.

detail.abstract: This research explores the socioeconomic implications of the Philippines' differentiated minimum wage policy on workers across regions. It examines how wage variation, set by regional wage boards, influences labor productivity, household income, and employment opportunities. Using a review of local and international literature, government data, and economic theory, the study highlights the adverse outcomes of fragmented wage systems, including increased income inequality, regional labor migration, and underemployment. The findings suggest that the current minimum wage structure, although designed to reflect local economic realities, often undermines national goals for equitable development and decent work. The study recommends re-evaluating the wage-setting mechanism toward a unified or harmonized wage system that ensures fair labor compensation without compromising economic growth.

title: Conflict and Healthcare: Evidence from Gujarat
affiliations: University College Dublin (UCD)

detail.title: Conflict and Healthcare: Evidence from Gujarat
detail.abstract: In this paper, I examine whether the 2002 Gujarat riot in India disrupted maternal healthcare utilisation. Using data from the 2002-04 District-Level Household Survey (DLHS-2) and a sharp Regression Discontinuity Design around the date of the riot, I find no statistically significant effects on institutional delivery, caesarean section rates, post-pregnancy complications, or polio drops given to newborns at birth. Subgroup analysis, however, suggests a decline in hospital deliveries among women aged 30 or younger and among Muslim women statewide, but these effects are not robust across alternative bandwidths. The results should be interpreted in light of possible recall bias and survey timing. NGO activity and community health networks may have mitigated the short-run disruptions to maternal healthcare, though this study does not directly test these mechanisms.

title: How Brazil’s Educa+ Bond Could Transform Education Financing Globally: A Case Study
affiliations: Georgetown University - McDonough School of Business, Fundação Getúlio Vargas SP and Cysne Finanças

detail.title: How Brazil’s Educa+ Bond Could Transform Education Financing Globally: A Case Study
detail.abstract: In 2023, Brazil issued two new retail-targeted bonds, RendA+ (retirement “income extra”) and Educa+ (“education extra”), with cash flows customized to the specific goals of individual investors. Brazil was uniquely positioned to introduce these new instruments because it has successfully implemented financial innovations such as Tesouro Direto, a liquid, efficient, and long-maturity Extended National Consumer Price Index (IPCA)-linked market for long maturity bonds, and the highly efficient Pix system to effect electronic financial transfers. This paper presents some crucial steps in launching the world’s first retail-targeted education bonds, the condition of the Treasury market in Brazil before introduction of these bonds, main features of Educa+, some innovations, and results after nearly 2 years of issuance. The purpose of the paper is to serve as a case study for other countries considering the introduction of similar instruments to improve education financing – especially important as American universities are facing severe funding issues,  foreign students unlikely to study in America, and endowments stuck with illiquid assets.

AI.tldr: 巴西在2023年推出了两种针对零售投资者的新型债券RendA+和Educa+，本文分析了其创新性、市场背景及效果，为其他国家提供教育融资案例参考。
AI.research_question: 巴西如何成功推出全球首个针对教育目标的零售债券Educa+，并对其市场效果进行分析？
AI.motivation: 美国大学面临资金问题，国际学生减少，捐赠基金流动性差，巴西的创新债券模式可能为其他国家提供解决方案。
AI.theoretical_framework: 金融创新理论、零售债券市场理论、教育融资理论。
AI.method: 案例研究，分析巴西国债市场背景、Educa+债券的主要特点及创新点。
AI.findings: 巴西成功推出Educa+债券，展示了金融创新在解决教育融资问题中的潜力。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了零售债券市场和教育融资的理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为其他国家提供了一种可行的教育融资创新模式。

title: How European securitisation could assist SME financing
affiliations: Risk Control Limited

detail.title: How European securitisation could assist SME financing
detail.abstract: The recent financial crisis has brought severe financing shortages for SMEs in many countries, especially in Europe. Banks engaged in rebuilding their balance sheets and satisfy new Basel rules on capital and liquidity have been strongly incentivised to scale back their lending to SMEs. The result has been high lending spreads and the rejection of many loan applications for SMEs particularly in Eurozone periphery countries.The financing constraints on SMEs could be solved in part by reviving the European SME-loan-backed securitisation market. This would permit banks to increase lending while still meeting Basel III capital requirements. But, changes are needed in the regulatory stance if this is to happen.Differentiation in capital and liquidity rules between High Quality Securitisations and more risky, less transparent and simple deals is necessary. Reducing reliance on agency ratings in securitisation regulation would also contribute.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了欧洲中小企业融资短缺问题，提出通过重启中小企业贷款证券化市场缓解融资约束，并建议调整监管政策以支持这一目标。
AI.research_question: 如何通过重启欧洲中小企业贷款证券化市场缓解融资短缺问题？
AI.motivation: 金融危机导致银行减少对中小企业的贷款，加剧了融资困难，尤其是在欧元区边缘国家。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于巴塞尔协议III的资本和流动性要求，探讨证券化对银行放贷能力的影响。
AI.method: 分析现有监管政策对证券化市场的限制，提出差异化资本和流动性规则的解决方案。
AI.findings: 通过重启中小企业贷款证券化市场，银行可以在满足资本要求的同时增加贷款。

AI.practical_contributions: 提出了减少对评级机构依赖和调整监管政策的建议，以促进中小企业融资。

title: Contracts: Reterritorialising the (Global) Exercise of Authority
affiliations: Edinburgh Law School

detail.title: Contracts: Reterritorialising the (Global) Exercise of Authority
detail.abstract: The modern practices of authority by states and non-state actors alike are at odds with international law's orthodox time-spaces causing disciplinary anxiety. As a result, although there is a sense of the importance of global value chains (GVCs), these are invisible to the disciplinary gaze. This is not limited to international law; neo-formalist contract law and private international law suffer the same fate. There is for some a turn to 'the global' to understand alterity. In this paper, I argue that understanding the time-spaces created by the practice of contracting can offer important reflection on, amongst other things, what 'the global' is. The paper explores the practice of exercising authority through contractual relations at the level of the individual contract, the chain as a whole, and the use of standardised contractual clauses and model contracts. The article suggests these contractual relations are constitutive not only of spatiality but of territoriality. As such, it is possible to reterritorialize global phenomena, and 'the global', that have until now been understood to have deterritorialized from state or international legal orders.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了现代国家和非国家行为体的权威实践与国际法正统时空观的冲突，提出通过合同实践理解“全球”概念，并分析了合同关系如何重构空间性和领土性。
AI.research_question: 如何通过合同实践理解“全球”概念及其时空重构？
AI.motivation: 现代权威实践与国际法正统时空观的冲突导致全球价值链（GVCs）等概念在学科视野中不可见，亟需新的理论视角。
AI.theoretical_framework: 结合国际法、新形式主义合同法和国际私法理论，探讨合同实践对时空和领土性的重构。
AI.method: 分析个体合同、整体链条以及标准化合同条款和模板合同的权威实践。
AI.findings: 合同关系不仅构成空间性，还重构领土性，从而可以重新领土化全球现象。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出通过合同实践理解“全球”的新视角，丰富了国际法和合同法的理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者和法律实践者提供了重新思考全球价值链和合同关系的实践工具。

title: Unlocking Women's Workforce Potential in India: Quantifying the Labor Market Impact of Formalizing Part-time Employment and Gender Equality in Unpaid Care Work
affiliations: National Council of Applied Economic Research (NCAER) and National Council of Applied Economic Research (NCAER)

detail.title: Unlocking Women's Workforce Potential in India: Quantifying the Labor Market Impact of Formalizing Part-time Employment and Gender Equality in Unpaid Care Work

publicationDetails.detailsText: NCAER Working Papers 178, 2025, National Council of Applied Economic Research, New Delhi

detail.abstract: In this paper, we investigate the macroeconomic and labor market implications of gender equality in unpaid care work and the formalization of part-time employment in India. The unequal distribution of unpaid care responsibilities significantly limits women's labor force participation, perpetuating gender disparities in employment and economic outcomes. Using the McCall-Mortensen macroeconomic job search framework, this paper models the potential impacts of policy interventions on female labor force participation rates (LFPR). A key contribution of the paper is to derive quantitative estimates via model simulation. We find that formalizing part-time employment contracts and equalizing the time burden of unpaid care work between genders predict a 6-percentage point increase in female LFPR, raising the current rate from 37% to 43%. The findings underscore the critical need for formalizing part-time employment contracts in India. Flexibly implemented part-time employment can empower women to balance labor force participation with domestic caregiving responsibilities, by providing greater control over their working hours. Equalizing the burden of unpaid care would require raising public investment in childcare and eldercare infrastructure, and policies promoting paid parental leave and tax incentives for shared care. Drawing on best practices from the advanced world, the study emphasizes the role of flexibility in enabling women to balance professional and domestic responsibilities.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了印度无酬照护工作中的性别平等和兼职就业正规化的宏观经济及劳动力市场影响，发现政策干预可显著提高女性劳动力参与率。
AI.research_question: 性别平等在无酬照护工作和兼职就业正规化对印度宏观经济和劳动力市场的影响是什么？
AI.motivation: 无酬照护责任的不平等分配显著限制了女性的劳动力参与，加剧了就业和经济结果中的性别差距。
AI.theoretical_framework: McCall-Mortensen宏观经济工作搜索框架。
AI.method: 通过模型模拟得出定量估计。
AI.findings: 正规化兼职就业合同和性别间无酬照护时间负担均等化预计可将女性劳动力参与率提高6个百分点（从37%升至43%）。
AI.theory_contributions: 为性别平等和无酬照护工作的宏观经济影响提供了定量分析框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 强调正规化兼职就业合同和公共投资照护基础设施的重要性，并借鉴国际最佳实践提出政策建议。

title: NLPLearnX: A Student-Driven AI Platform for Adaptive Learning with Entrepreneurship and IPR Perspectives
affiliations: Rashtreeya Vidyalaya College of Engineering (RVCE), Rashtreeya Vidyalaya College of Engineering (RVCE), Rashtreeya Vidyalaya College of Engineering (RVCE) and Rashtreeya Vidyalaya College of Engineering (RVCE)

detail.title: NLPLearnX: A Student-Driven AI Platform for Adaptive Learning with Entrepreneurship and IPR Perspectives

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare that there is no conflict of interest regarding the publication of this paper. No personal or financial relationships influenced the outcomes or design of this study.
declarations.ethicsApproval: none

detail.abstract: Many students, particularly those transitioning from diploma-level education, encounter significant challenges in mastering advanced subjects such as programming, mathematics, and core engineering disciplines. These challenges are often exacerbated by the absence of personalized learning paths, simplified instructional materials, and foundational support. This paper presents NLPLearnX, an AI-powered adaptive learning platform that leverages Natural Language Processing (NLP) and gener-ative AI to enhance educational outcomes. The system initiates with a diagnostic quiz to evaluate the learner's prior knowledge and subsequently recommends a personalized learning path using performance-driven analytics. Core functionalities include automated text summarization using the T5 Transformer model, multi-PDF content aggregation with chapterwise organization, and a built-in rule-based chatbot for real-time academic support. Students can upload educational resources, access curated notes, and assess their progress through quizzes. Additionally, the platform enables subject matter experts-including alumni and tutors-to contribute content, thereby fostering a collaborative learning ecosystem. By integrating personalized module recommendation , AI-based summarization, interactive assessments, and community-driven tutoring, NLPLearnX delivers a scalable, student-centric solution aimed at reducing learning gaps and improving self-paced learning efficiency.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了NLPLearnX，一个基于AI的自适应学习平台，通过NLP和生成式AI技术，为学生提供个性化学习路径、自动文本摘要、实时学术支持等功能，旨在缩小学习差距并提升学习效率。
AI.research_question: 如何利用AI技术（如NLP和生成式AI）为从文凭教育过渡的学生提供个性化的学习支持，以解决他们在高级学科学习中的挑战？
AI.motivation: 许多学生在学习高级学科（如编程、数学和工程）时面临挑战，主要原因是缺乏个性化学习路径和基础支持。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于自然语言处理（NLP）和生成式AI的理论框架，结合自适应学习系统的设计原则。
AI.method: 开发了NLPLearnX平台，包括诊断测试、个性化学习路径推荐、T5 Transformer模型自动摘要、多PDF内容整合、基于规则的聊天机器人等功能。
AI.findings: NLPLearnX通过个性化模块推荐、AI摘要、互动评估和社区驱动的辅导，有效缩小学习差距并提升学习效率。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一个结合NLP和生成式AI的自适应学习框架，丰富了教育技术领域的理论应用。
AI.practical_contributions: 提供了一个可扩展的学生中心解决方案，支持个性化学习和协作式教育生态系统的构建。

detail.abstract: Mergers of Public Sector Banks: An Analysis. Consolidation or Merger of Public Sector Banks in India is not an alien concept, as far as the Indian Banking Sector is concerned. It has been envisaged in the past by the Narasimham Committee back in 1991, and since then effective action has been undertaken by the Government in association with the ministry of finance to facilitate the creation of strong and robust banks to meet the credit requirements of a growing and aspirational economy.

AI.research_question: 印度公共部门银行的合并是否有助于创建更强健的银行以满足经济增长的信贷需求？

title: Potential Risks and Drawbacks of the Widespread Adoption of Self-driving Vehicles
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Potential Risks and Drawbacks of the Widespread Adoption of Self-driving Vehicles
detail.abstract: The adoption of self-driving vehicles (AVs) promises to transform transportation by improving safety, reducing traffic congestion, and cutting carbon emissions. Proponents highlight the potential for significant reductions in human error-related accidents and greenhouse gas emissions through increased use of electric and autonomous vehicles. However, this paper critically examines the risks and drawbacks of widespread AV deployment. It explores legal and ethical challenges, such as questions of liability in accidents and the classic trolley problem in programming ethical decisions. It also addresses serious privacy and cybersecurity risks arising from the collection and storage of sensitive data, as well as the threat of remote hacking. Additionally, the paper considers the potential for large-scale job displacement among drivers and the socioeconomic consequences of such a shift. Through a balanced analysis, this paper underscores the need for robust regulation, clear accountability frameworks, and thoughtful planning to mitigate these risks as AV technology advances.

AI.tldr: 本文批判性分析了自动驾驶汽车（AVs）广泛部署的风险与缺点，包括法律伦理挑战、隐私与网络安全风险，以及大规模失业问题，强调需要强有力的监管和规划。

AI.motivation: 尽管自动驾驶汽车有望提升交通安全和环保性，但其潜在风险（如法律伦理问题、隐私安全和失业问题）尚未得到充分探讨。

AI.method: 通过批判性分析和文献综述，探讨自动驾驶汽车的潜在风险。
AI.findings: 自动驾驶汽车部署面临法律伦理挑战、隐私与网络安全风险，以及大规模失业的社会经济后果。

title: Redesigning Incentives for Transparency: Fixed Broadband Quality and Regulatory Challenges in Japan
affiliations: Faculty of Policy Studies, Chuo University

detail.title: Redesigning Incentives for Transparency: Fixed Broadband Quality and Regulatory Challenges in Japan
detail.abstract: Despite Japan’s advanced fiber-optic infrastructure, a persistent gap between advertised and actual broadband speeds continues to erode consumer trust and hinder market efficiency. This study combines an original survey of 640 users, international regulatory comparisons, and game-theoretic analysis to uncover the underlying causes of this transparency gap. The statistical findings indicate that compensation demands stem from both perceived dissatisfaction and measurable service underperformance. To address this, this study proposes a three-tiered measurement framework—crowdsourced performance data, standardized Internet Service Provider disclosures, and independent third-party audits—to better align market incentives. By doing so, transparency is repositioned not as a regulatory burden but as a catalyst for fair and sustainable competition.

AI.tldr: 日本光纤基础设施先进，但宽带广告速度与实际速度的差距持续削弱消费者信任并阻碍市场效率。本研究结合640名用户的调查、国际监管比较和博弈论分析，揭示透明度差距的根本原因。统计结果表明，补偿需求源于感知不满和可测量的服务表现不佳。为此，研究提出三层测量框架——众包性能数据、标准化ISP披露和独立第三方审计——以更好地调整市场激励。
AI.research_question: 日本宽带广告速度与实际速度的透明度差距的根本原因是什么？
AI.motivation: 消费者信任和市场效率因宽带速度不透明而受损，亟需解决。
AI.theoretical_framework: 博弈论分析。
AI.method: 结合640名用户的原始调查、国际监管比较和博弈论分析。
AI.findings: 补偿需求源于感知不满和可测量的服务表现不佳。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出透明度作为公平和可持续竞争的催化剂。
AI.practical_contributions: 提出三层测量框架（众包数据、标准化披露和第三方审计）以改善市场激励。

reference: Gewerblicher Rechtsschutz und Urheberrecht - International, Volume 74 (2025), forthcoming
title: GenAI and the Copyright Three-Step Test – Do TDM Exceptions for AI Training Conflict With a Work’s Normal Exploitation?
affiliations: Institute for Information Law (IViR), University of Amsterdam

detail.title: GenAI and the Copyright Three-Step Test – Do TDM Exceptions for AI Training Conflict With a Work’s Normal Exploitation?

publicationDetails.detailsText: Gewerblicher Rechtsschutz und Urheberrecht - International, Volume 74 (2025), forthcoming

detail.abstract:
Text and data mining (TDM) for AI training can be regarded as the starting point of a complex process that impacts the market for human literary and artistic creations in different ways. The machine is only capable of mimicking human content after it had the opportunity to derive patterns for its own productions from myriad human creations that served as training resources. Once AI training has been completed and a generative AI (GenAI) system is brought to the market, AI output may support fruitful human/machine collaboration. However, it may also kill demand for the same human creativity that empowered the AI system to become a competitor in the first place. In the terminology of the ubiquitous three-step test in international and European copyright law, this latter challenge raises the question whether copyright exceptions permitting TDM for AI training cause a conflict with a work’s normal exploitation.

A closer inspection of the normal exploitation test shows that the chances of demonstrating a relevant conflict are slim in the case of AI training. Rightsholders seeking compensation for displacement effects caused by GenAI systems must resort to the final criterion of the three-step test and argue that the use for AI development unreasonably prejudices their legitimate interests. In practice, this means that copyright holders can hardly employ the three-step test as a tool to erode TDM exemptions altogether. They can only insist on the introduction of appropriate remuneration schemes to avoid unreasonable prejudice in cases of commercial AI training.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了文本与数据挖掘（TDM）在AI训练中对人类文学艺术创作市场的影响，分析了版权法中的“三步测试”是否适用于AI训练导致的潜在冲突，并指出权利持有人难以完全否定TDM豁免，但可主张合理补偿。
AI.research_question: 版权例外允许的TDM用于AI训练是否与作品的正常利用产生冲突？
AI.motivation: AI训练依赖人类创作数据，可能成为人类创作的竞争对手，引发版权法如何平衡创新的问题。
AI.theoretical_framework: 国际和欧洲版权法中的“三步测试”理论。
AI.method: 通过法律分析和案例研究，探讨AI训练对版权法的影响。
AI.findings: AI训练难以证明与作品正常利用的冲突，权利持有人可通过主张合理补偿解决不公平损害。
AI.theory_contributions: 为AI训练与版权法的关系提供了理论框架，明确了“三步测试”的适用边界。
AI.practical_contributions: 建议权利持有人通过合理补偿机制而非否定TDM豁免来保护利益，为政策制定提供参考。

title: Confidence and Information in Strategy-Proof School Choice
affiliations: Humboldt University of Berlin - Faculty of Economics and Business Administration, Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin) - Faculty of Economics and Management, Halle Institute for Economic Research and Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin)

detail.title: Confidence and Information in Strategy-Proof School Choice
detail.abstract: Contrary to classical theory, we provide experimental evidence that preference reports in a strategy-proof school-choice mechanism systematically depend on beliefs. We employ a "hard-easy gap" to exogenously vary students' beliefs about their priority rank. As predicted, underconfidence induces more manipulation and thus more justified envy than overconfidence. The effect of priority information on justified envy crucially depends on the initial beliefs and the real priority ranks: while top students always gain, non-top students lose from this information. In total, correcting overconfidence/underconfidence increases/decreases justified envy. Finally, we confirm that additionally providing information on school availability through a dynamic implementation of the mechanism reduces justified envy compared to priority information alone.

AI.tldr: 实验表明，在策略证明的学校选择机制中，偏好报告系统性地依赖于信念。通过“难易差距”外生地改变学生对优先排名的信念，研究发现自信不足导致更多操纵行为，从而增加合理嫉妒。优先信息对合理嫉妒的影响取决于初始信念和实际优先排名：顶尖学生总是受益，而非顶尖学生则受损。纠正过度自信/自信不足会增加/减少合理嫉妒。动态机制提供学校可用性信息能进一步减少合理嫉妒。
AI.research_question: 在策略证明的学校选择机制中，信念如何影响偏好报告及合理嫉妒？
AI.motivation: 挑战经典理论，揭示信念对学校选择机制的实际影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 策略证明机制、信念与决策行为理论。
AI.method: 实验设计，通过“难易差距”外生改变信念，分析数据。
AI.findings: 自信不足增加操纵行为和合理嫉妒；优先信息对合理嫉妒的影响因学生初始信念和实际排名而异；动态机制提供学校可用性信息能减少合理嫉妒。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展对信念在策略证明机制中作用的理解。
AI.practical_contributions: 为学校选择机制设计提供改进建议，如动态信息提供。

title: Implementation of SEC-IRBA by European Banks
affiliations: Risk Control Limited

detail.title: Implementation of SEC-IRBA by European Banks
detail.abstract:
This paper provides a comment on the Regulatory Technical Standard (RTS) recently issued by the European Banking Authority’s (EBA) on the use of the Purchased Receivables Approach (PuRA) by European banks. The RTS is designed to clarify an important component of the Basel 3 rules for securitisation capital as applied to banks in Europe. The PuRA would be used by banks to calculate inputs to the SEC-IRBA, the most advanced of the hierarchy of approaches that banks are permitted to employ when calculating regulatory capital for securitisation exposures in the banking book.

To illustrate the implementation of the PuRA, we estimate a set of models based on European Data Warehouse (ED) data for residential mortgages. We estimate models for 8 European countries using loan level data for the pools of 504 Residential Mortgage Backed Security deals. We are able to formulate models at country, originator and deal levels. We examine how data from these different models may be combined to estimate PDs for a single notional deal. We discuss how adjustments may be made for originator underwriting standards and for different Margins of Conservatism. The exercises we perform help us to identify ways in which the EBA’s RTS could be helpfully extended or made more precise.

We conclude that there are three areas in which the RTS could be clarified. First, the RTS state that the data hierarchy for banks implementing the PuRA is the inverse of what would normally hold for an IRB model implementation in that external data on exposures resembling those of the securitisation pool in question should be preferred to the bank’s internal data on loans that it has originated itself. This implies that PuRA modelling should be considered as the development of a methodology that can be applied to multiple datasets in a dynamic way as securitisation deals present themselves. It would be helpful for the EBA to acknowledge this as it represents a significant departure from the usual IRB modelling practice and has multiple important implications.

Second, the EBA has provided little guidance in the crucial area of what data is acceptable. A key question is whether aggregate performance data of the sort contained in securitisation market investor reports and used by ratings agencies in risk analysis of securitisations may serve as the basis for analysis or whether loan level data is essential to obtain supervisory approval. This study employs loan level data but we are aware that ratings agencies often analyse securitisations on the basis of cumulative default curves broken down by vintage.

Third, the EBA’s 2017 guidelines on IRB modelling require banks implementing IRB models to develop Margins of Conservatism and to allow for the impact of underwriting standards. While significant in other IRB exercises, these two requirements are central to PuRA modelling involving as it does multiple data sources used in a varied and dynamic way. Making all aspects of these activities fully statistical and data driven (without judgmental input) appears scarcely feasible. Acknowledging this even while stipulating that any judgments be prudent and evidence-based would be helpful.

AI.tldr: 本文评论了欧洲银行管理局（EBA）最近发布的关于欧洲银行使用购买应收账款方法（PuRA）的监管技术标准（RTS）。文章通过欧洲数据仓库的住房抵押贷款数据建模，提出了RTS在数据层级、数据可接受性和建模方法三个方面的改进建议。

AI.method: 使用欧洲数据仓库的住房抵押贷款数据，建立国家、发起人和交易层级的模型，分析数据组合和调整方法。

AI.practical_contributions: 为EBA提供了改进RTS的具体建议，帮助银行更有效地实施PuRA。

title: Who Bears the Burden? Heterogeneous Labor Market Penalties of Child and Eldercare
affiliations: University of California, San Diego (UCSD)

detail.title: Who Bears the Burden? Heterogeneous Labor Market Penalties of Child and Eldercare
detail.abstract: This paper investigates the labor market effects of family caregiving, focusing on childcare and eldercare. Using large panel data in Japan and an event-study design that accounts for staggered treatment timing, I find sizable and persistent employment penalties for females after childbirth. Mothers' employment decreases by 36 percentage points one year after childbirth and stays lower five years later by approximately 19 percentage points. These effects vary by job characteristics, contract type, and co-residence status, highlighting substantial heterogeneity. In contrast, eldercare has smaller, at most 5 percentage points, and often statistically insignificant average effects on employment. However, eldercare penalties are larger and statistically significant, reaching up to 10 percentage points, for females with certain pre-event characteristics: those in low-teleworkability jobs, those in high physical proximity jobs, those on non-regular contracts, and those employed in small firms.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了家庭照护（尤其是育儿和养老）对劳动力市场的影响，发现女性在生育后就业率显著下降，而养老照护的影响较小且因个体特征而异。
AI.research_question: 家庭照护（育儿和养老）对劳动力市场的影响是什么？
AI.motivation: 探讨家庭照护对就业的长期影响及其异质性，为政策制定提供依据。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于劳动力市场性别差异理论和家庭经济学理论。
AI.method: 使用日本的大规模面板数据和事件研究设计，考虑交错处理时间。
AI.findings: 生育导致女性就业率一年后下降36个百分点，五年后仍低19个百分点；养老照护的平均影响较小（最多5个百分点），但对特定群体（如低远程工作能力、非正规合同等）影响显著（达10个百分点）。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了家庭照护对就业的异质性影响，丰富了性别与劳动力市场理论。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了针对不同家庭照护需求和劳动力市场特征的干预方向。

title: Forecasting Assets under Management for Stress Testing and Strategy Purposes
affiliations: Risk Control Limited and Risk Control Limited

detail.title: Forecasting Assets under Management for Stress Testing and Strategy Purposes
detail.abstract:
For stress testing and strategy formulation, it is important for asset managers to forecast their Assets under Management (AUM) accurately. This paper develops statistical methods for forecasting AUM and applies them to data for 2,494 UK, French, German and Italian-domiciled funds. The results allow one to project forward AUM under different assumptions about market conditions and in a way that is customised for the age, size and fund flow and return histories of the funds in question.

Building on an extensive academic literature, we employ an approach that splits the dynamics of AUM into the contributions of returns and of fund flow (defined as the change in AUM less the effects of returns). We use statistical methods to model these two components separately and then combine the models to generate forecasts of AUM itself.

The effects implied by our estimates are broadly intuitive (in a qualitative sense) for the four domiciles of funds that we analyse. Lagged fund flow and lagged returns imply higher (percentage) growth as does being a young or a small fund. However, the (quantitative) sensitivities of fund flow to different effects and, in particular to lagged returns and lagged fund flow, are much greater for UK funds than for those from other domiciles we consider. Italian funds are least sensitive in this regard. We, also, find very pronounced non-linearities in the relations between fund flow and several of its key determinants.

AI.tldr: 本文开发了统计方法用于预测资产管理规模（AUM），并应用于2494只英国、法国、德国和意大利基金的数据，以在不同市场条件下定制化预测AUM。
AI.research_question: 如何准确预测资产管理规模（AUM）以支持压力测试和策略制定？
AI.motivation: 资产管理者需要准确预测AUM以进行压力测试和策略制定，但现有方法缺乏定制化和对不同市场条件的适应性。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于学术文献，将AUM动态分解为回报和资金流（定义为AUM变化减去回报影响）的贡献。
AI.method: 使用统计方法分别建模回报和资金流，然后结合模型生成AUM预测。
AI.findings: 研究发现，滞后资金流和滞后回报对AUM增长有正向影响，年轻或小型基金增长更快；英国基金对滞后回报和资金流的敏感性显著高于其他地区，意大利基金敏感性最低；资金流与其关键决定因素之间存在显著非线性关系。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了AUM预测的定制化统计方法，扩展了AUM动态分解的理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为资产管理者提供了在不同市场条件下定制化预测AUM的工具，支持更精准的压力测试和策略制定。

title: Drivers of Corporate Bond Market Liquidity in the European Union
affiliations: Risk Control Limited

detail.title: Drivers of Corporate Bond Market Liquidity in the European Union
detail.abstract:
This report for the European Commission provides comprehensive evidence on the evolution of market liquidity in the European corporate bond market.
The analysis is based on substantial datasets including MiFID 1 data provided by the FCA, transactions data from a leading Electronic Trading Platform (ETP), settlement data from a major clearing organisation, Euroclear, and large historical datasets of bond characteristic and quote information.

Activity-based indicators (such as turnover rates and trade numbers) suggest that liquidity has deteriorated in recent years. Price-based indicators (for example, bid-ask and effective spreads, round trip measures and market depth indicators) point to some recovery in liquidity after the crisis but deterioration after 2014. Conditional on the riskiness of individual bonds, both price and activity measures show declines in liquidity since 2011, suggesting a structural deterioration in liquidity.

The report also looks at various drivers of liquidity. These include (i) long-run structural  influences such as the growth of Electronic Trading Platforms (ETPs) and MiFID 2 changes in  pre- and post-trade transparency, and (ii) changes in market-maker profitability as evidenced by round trip measures and dealer inventories.  We compare the timing of changes in liquidity with regulatory developments.

AI.method: 使用MiFID 1数据、电子交易平台数据、结算数据以及债券特征和报价信息的历史数据集。

AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了流动性恶化的结构性原因，如电子交易平台的增长和MiFID 2的变化。
AI.practical_contributions: 为监管机构提供了流动性变化与监管发展的时间对比，有助于政策制定。

title: Solvency II Capital Calibration for Securitisations
affiliations: Risk Control Limited, Risk Control Limited and Risk Control Limited

detail.title: Solvency II Capital Calibration for Securitisations
detail.abstract: A significant obstacle to the revival of the European securitisation market is the high level of capital that insurers are required to hold against securitisation positions under Solvency II rules. This paper presents evidence on how securitisation capital for insurers should be calibrated. We analyse a large dataset of price data on individual tranches, construct return indices and measure the Value at Risk of different securitisation portfolios. We also analyse capital from a bottom up perspective, allocating Solvency II capital for asset pools to securitisation tranches using the Simplified Supervisory Formula Approach (SSFA) employed in the Basel III rules. We conclude that Solvency II capital charges for AAA-rated Type 1 tranches are double what the evidence suggests is appropriate. Charges for Type 2 tranches are also much higher than is justified by the data.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了欧洲证券化市场复苏的主要障碍——保险公司在Solvency II规则下需为证券化头寸持有的高额资本。通过分析大量价格数据、构建回报指数及测量不同证券化组合的风险价值，作者提出Solvency II对AAA级Type 1和Type 2证券化头寸的资本要求过高。

AI.practical_contributions: 建议调整资本要求以促进欧洲证券化市场复苏。

title: Rating Correlations and Macro Stress Testing

detail.abstract: This paper analyzes the joint distribution of changes in agency credit ratings. We estimate both intra-and inter-industry correlations using Maximum Likelihood techniques. The analysis is performed unconditionally and then conditional on detrended GDP. The latter estimates may be used for macro stress testing in which the credit quality of a portfolio is simulated conditional on a hypothesized future path of real output.

title: Dispute Resolution Under Pillar Two: Can the Coordinated Unilateralism of the Globe's 'Common Approach' Deliver Legal Certainty in Globe Tax Controversies?
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Dispute Resolution Under Pillar Two: Can the Coordinated Unilateralism of the Globe's 'Common Approach' Deliver Legal Certainty in Globe Tax Controversies?
detail.abstract: This paper examines the critical need for a robust dispute resolution mechanism under Pillar Two of the OECD's GloBE rules, which usher in a new era of international corporate tax. While the GloBE rules operate as a "common approach" without a binding multilateral convention, their uncoordinated application and interpretation across jurisdictions are highly likely to generate significant tax controversies and double taxation. The OECD acknowledges this, yet concrete guidance on dispute resolution remains elusive. The paper classifies potential GloBE disputes into "internal" (e.g., conflicts over GloBE income calculation or UTPR allocation) and "external" (e.g., clashes with existing tax treaty principles like the arm's length principle). It analyzes various proposals for dispute resolution, focusing on the Mutual Agreement Procedure (MAP) under bilateral tax treaties. While MAP offers a familiar framework, its limitations include incomplete treaty networks, the absence of legislative MAP clauses in many treaties, and its inherent opaqueness, which hinders dispute prevention. Alternative approaches, such as domestic law mechanisms based on reciprocity (as seen in Italy) and a dedicated multilateral convention for GloBE MAP, are also explored. While a dedicated dispute resolution mechanism in a multilateral convention is deemed preferable for its comprehensive scope and potential for transparency, its political feasibility remains a significant hurdle. The paper concludes that without a cogent and legally authoritative dispute resolution mechanism, the "coordinated unilateralism" of the GloBE regime may struggle to deliver the necessary legal certainty for taxpayers amidst inevitable cross-border tax controversies.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了OECD全球最低税规则（Pillar Two）下建立有效争议解决机制的必要性，分析了潜在争议类型及现有解决方法的局限性，并提出了多边公约作为理想解决方案的可行性挑战。
AI.research_question: 如何在OECD全球最低税规则（Pillar Two）下建立有效的争议解决机制以避免税收争议和双重征税？

title: The Naked King, Common Nonsense, and the Possibilities of Good Social Science
affiliations: Rabindra Bharati University

detail.title: The Naked King, Common Nonsense, and the Possibilities of Good Social Science

declarations.declarationOfInterest: No Conflict of Interest with anybody else
declarations.funderStatement: Not funded

publicationDetails.detailsText: The article was published in the West Bengal Political Science Review; Vol- XXIV (2022-23) 243-268

detail.abstract: What social science can do for a better everyday life, beyond offering suggestions to decision-makers who frequently ignore them, is undoubtedly a recurrent topic in question for decades. How is it even possible to do social research that could produce effective outcomes in people's daily lives? The questions highlight the discipline's practical value to society. The article, taking clues from the relevant literature, attempts to answer these perennial questions and argues that social science while representing uncommon sense as a specialized domain of knowledge might be crucial to anticipate and prevent mishaps in daily life by updating common sense and taking people away from common nonsense.

title: Community Engagement: How Banks Gain an Analog Advantage in the FinTech Age
affiliations: Mississippi State University and Mississippi State University

detail.title: Community Engagement: How Banks Gain an Analog Advantage in the FinTech Age

declarations.declarationOfInterest: Nothing to declare.

detail.abstract: We explore the extent to which community banks are engaged in their local communities and assess the effects of such engagement on both local communities and community banks. Using a novel news-based measure of community engagement, we find that larger, federally-chartered community banks operating in a single state are more likely to participate in local activities. Engaged banks originate more loans to small businesses and more mortgage loans in their local communities, especially in low-income areas. Using natural disasters as an exogenous shock, we provide evidence that the relation is causal. Furthermore, we find that counties with a larger fraction of engaged community banks experience faster recoveries from natural disasters. Finally, we document that engaged banks have faster deposit growth, lower deposit volatility, better asset quality, and were less likely to experience large deposit withdrawals during the recent regional banking crisis The results suggest that establishing local ties with the community helps banks mitigate information asymmetries that are common in small business lending and can be a way for such banks to mitigate adverse effects of increased competition and maintain an edge in a digital age.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了社区银行在本地社区中的参与程度及其对社区和银行自身的影响。研究发现，规模较大、联邦特许且在单一州运营的社区银行更可能参与本地活动，且这些银行在低收入地区发放更多小企业贷款和抵押贷款。通过自然灾害作为外生冲击，研究证明了这种关系的因果性。此外，社区银行参与度高的县在灾后恢复更快。研究还发现，参与度高的银行在近期区域性银行危机中表现更好。

title: The 5% Securitisation Retention Threshold: A Short Technical History

detail.title: The 5% Securitisation Retention Threshold: A Short Technical History
detail.abstract: To discourage the "originate-to-distribute" business model (which created the US subprime mortgage securitisation industry and caused the recent financial crisis) policymakers require that originators retain sufficient risk to have so-called "skin-in-the-game". In defining retention rules, European policymakers settled on the wording of "not less than 5%". The 5% value was selected, instead of a higher percentage such as 10% or 20%, because of constraints imposed by the international accounting standard, IAS 39. IFRS 9, which will replace IAS 39 in 2018, will similarly constrain what is feasible. This short note explains how accounting constraints drove the choice of 5% and explains why these constraints will apply under IFRS 9.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了会计准则如何影响欧洲政策制定者选择5%的风险保留比例，并解释了IFRS 9下这些约束的延续。

title: Sailing through uncertainty: Shipping's role in financial shock transmission and hedging strategies
affiliations: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens, NATIONAL AND KAPODISTRIAN UNIVERSITY OF ATHENS, National and Kapodistrian University of Athens - Department of Economics and National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

detail.title: Sailing through uncertainty: Shipping's role in financial shock transmission and hedging strategies
detail.abstract: Given shipping's pivotal role in global trade, this study investigates interdependencies between the Baltic Dry Index and various financial and commodity markets, including equities, bonds, real estate, currency, bitcoin, crude oil, natural gas, gold, silver, copper, and zinc. Using the R 2 decomposed connectedness approach for the period 1/1/2012-1/31/2025, the analysis reveals moderate volatility spillovers, notably amplified by geopolitical conflict more than the health crisis. Key findings identify gold and equities as primary shock emitters, while currency and bonds function as major receivers. Shipping generally displays neutral behavior within the network. Portfolio analysis shows that most sampled assets significantly reduce risk for shipping investors. Conversely, shipping effectively minimizes risk for bitcoin and natural gas portfolios. Significant heterogeneity in hedging effectiveness is documented across distinct crisis episodes. These results underscore the imperative for shipping investors to employ tailored hedging strategies and offer policymakers insight into shipping's contained systemic footprint on contagion dynamics.

title: Oral Traditions and Cultural Identity in Tribal Folklore in India
affiliations: S.R. Fatepuria College

detail.title: Oral Traditions and Cultural Identity in Tribal Folklore in India
detail.abstract: India's tribal communities represent one of the richest repositories of oral traditions in the world. Through storytelling, chants, songs, epics, riddles, and rituals, these communities have preserved their histories, worldviews, and social systems for generations without written records. This article explores the intricate relationship between oral traditions and cultural identity in Indian tribal societies. It examines how folklore functions not only as entertainment but also as a vehicle for transmitting values, ecological knowledge, spiritual beliefs, and historical memory. Drawing on examples from tribes such as the Santals, Gonds, Bhils, and Nagas, the study reveals how oral traditions reinforce community cohesion, affirm collective identity, and resist cultural erasure in the face of modernization, displacement, and homogenization. The article also assesses the challenges these traditions face and suggests strategies for their preservation and integration into mainstream cultural narratives and educational systems.

This study critically examines the evolution and impact of tribal development policies in India, analysing their objectives, implementation frameworks, and real-world implications. It also explores the contradictions between state-led modernization and indigenous autonomy, highlighting successes, gaps, and the way forward for inclusive and sustainable development.

keywords: psychological game theory JEL classification: C70

detail.abstract: I characterize the pure strategy equilibria in complete information, first-price sealed-bid auctions when bidders have reciprocity preferences. While the equilibria under selfish preferences persist, two additional types of equilibria arise under reciprocity. There is an equilibrium with negative reciprocity in which a bidder with a low value may refuse to lose by overbidding to win the auction. There is also an equilibrium with positive reciprocity in which several bidders collude by submitting a tying bid at a low price.

title: Does the Federal Reserve Control the Money Supply? A Time Series Analysis of US Data
affiliations: University of California, Berkeley

detail.title: Does the Federal Reserve Control the Money Supply? A Time Series Analysis of US Data
detail.abstract: While mainstream economists largely teach that money is exogenously created by the Central Bank, a new theory positing that money is endogenously created directly through bank loans has gained traction. Using Autoregressive Distributed Lag (ARDL), Vector Autoregression (VAR), and Vector Error Correction (VECM) time series econometric models, I empirically analyze US FRED monetary data to test whether the money supply appears to be exogenous or endogenous in the United States. Furthermore, I test to see if the Discount rate, reserve requirements, and interest on reserves set by the Federal Reserve are effective policy tools for indirectly controlling the money supply. I find that while money clearly has significant endogenous origin, the Federal Reserve still maintains a notable level of control over the money supply, although the extent to which it does this is somewhat unclear. I conclude with a brief discussion of implications for business cycle theory.

title: Tribal Perspectives on Sustainable Living and Natural Resource Management in India

detail.title: Tribal Perspectives on Sustainable Living and Natural Resource Management in India
detail.abstract: India's tribal communities, comprising over 8.6% of the national population, possess a profound and holistic understanding of sustainable living and natural resource management. Rooted in centuries-old cultural traditions and ecological wisdom, their practices emphasize harmony with nature, resource conservation, and community-based governance. This paper explores tribal perspectives on sustainability through an interdisciplinary lens, focusing on traditional ecological practices, community resource management, legal frameworks such as the Forest Rights Act (2006) and PESA (1996), and contemporary challenges including land alienation, climate change, and socio-political marginalization. By examining case studies from tribes like the Dongria Kondh, Apatani, and Baiga, the study highlights successful models of indigenous conservation and resistance. It argues for the integration of tribal knowledge into mainstream policy, education, and environmental planning, and recommends participatory governance mechanisms and support for indigenous livelihoods. The findings underline the urgent need to shift from exploitative development paradigms toward inclusive and ecologically sound frameworks, positioning tribal communities as pivotal agents in India's pursuit of sustainable development.

title: Interest Rates aren't a Price on Capital: Solving the Cambridge Capital Controversies
affiliations: University of California, Berkeley

detail.title: Interest Rates aren't a Price on Capital: Solving the Cambridge Capital Controversies
detail.abstract: Sraffa (1960) identifies mathematical examples of "paradoxes" such as reverse capital deepening, "anti-neoclassical" Wicksell effects, and "reswitching" in cost minimizing choice of production technique scenarios. In conjunction with Robinson's (1953) critique of the neoclassical production function, these critiques of the neoclassical theory of capital and interest became known as the Cambridge Capital Controversies. Samuelson (1966) capitulates to the Neo-Ricardian attack, admitting reswitching theoretically refutes the neoclassical theory of capital and defense of capitalist distribution, but New Keynesian economics largely ignores the controversy without providing a satisfactory solution in the eyes of Neo-Ricardian economists. I propose an alternative theory of capital as solution to the reswitching conundrum by recasting interest rates as an expression of time-preference rather than the marginal productivity of capital. I synthesize insights from Robinson, Bliss, Böhm-Bawerk, Kirzner, and Murphy to provide a new foundation for capital theory.

detail.abstract: This study explores the role of gamification in enhancing academic library services in India by surveying library leaders across various institutions. Using game-like elements in non-game contexts, gamification can boost user engagement and improve services such as information literacy and research consultations. Findings reveal moderate awareness and generally positive perceptions of gamification's effectiveness. However, challenges like insufficient staff expertise, infrastructure, and limited funding hinder implementation. The study emphasises the need for additional resources, including staff training and technological upgrades, to unlock the full potential of gamification in academic libraries.

detail.abstract: We provide evidence on the sensitivity of intergenerational mobility measurements described in Chetty et al. (2014) to local labor market shocks. We show that the fracking boom and Chinese import competition led to substantial changes in upward social mobility, and that between 10-15 percent of the spatial variation in absolute upward mobility can be explained by these two geographically concentrated shocks alone. Our results demonstrate that these mobility measures are (1) sensitive to shocks that occur between measurement of child and parental income and that (2) industry-specific shocks can explain similar amounts of the variation in mobility as social factors.

detail.abstract: This paper proposes a fusion of two economic paradigms, the economic goods framework and Total Economic Value (TEV), to structure the evaluation of complex space programs. It illustrates the dynamic relationship between different types of economic goods, including the institutional integration of manufactured private goods into public goods, as exemplified by civilian satellite navigation. Drawing on methodologies from environmental economics, particularly categories such as option and existential values, the approach addresses less obvious outcomes of space activities that nonetheless significantly shape public perceptions and judgments of program effectiveness. Current institutional developments in space activities demonstrate the relevance of economic goods and value epistemology as a framework for understanding and designing space policy.

detail.abstract: Education systems across the African continent remain deeply influenced by colonial legacies, Eurocentric epistemologies, and linear models of learning that fail to resonate with the lived experiences, cognitive ecologies, and cultural logics of African learners. This paper applies the Moleka Grid as a transformative ontological diagnostic framework to critically assess and reimagine educational design. By foregrounding ontological symptoms, epistemic paradigms, and deep system structures, the framework identifies foundational dissonances in curriculum, pedagogy, and institutional architecture. Through illustrative African case studies, the paper demonstrates how trans-epistemic and meta-learning models can help re-anchor education in pluriversal, adaptive, and intelligence-centered frameworks.

title: Markowitz Variance May Vastly Undervalue or Overestimate Portfolio Variance and Risks
affiliations: Independent Researcher

detail.title: Markowitz Variance May Vastly Undervalue or Overestimate Portfolio Variance and Risks

declarations.declarationOfInterest: nothing to declare
declarations.ethicsApproval: nothing to declare
declarations.funderStatement: This research received no support, specific grant, or financial assistance from funding agencies in the public, commercial, or nonprofit sectors.

detail.abstract: We consider the investor who doesn't trade shares of his portfolio. The investor only observes the current trades made in the market with his securities to estimate the current return, variance, and risks of his unchanged portfolio. We show how the time series of consecutive trades made in the market with the securities of the portfolio can determine the time series that model the trades with the portfolio as with a single security. That establishes the equal description of the market-based variance of the securities and of the portfolio composed of these securities that account for the fluctuations of the volumes of the consecutive trades. We show that Markowitz's (1952) variance describes only the approximation when all volumes of the consecutive trades with securities are assumed constant. The market-based variance depends on the coefficient of variation of fluctuations of volumes of trades. To emphasize this dependence and to estimate possible deviation from Markowitz variance, we derive the Taylor series of the market-based variance up to the 2 nd term by the coefficient of variation, taking Markowitz variance as a zero approximation. We consider three limiting cases with low and high fluctuations of the portfolio returns, and with a zero covariance of trade values and volumes and show that the impact of the coefficient of variation of trade volume fluctuations can cause Markowitz's assessment to highly undervalue or overestimate the market-based variance of the portfolio. Incorrect assessments of the variances of securities and of the portfolio cause wrong risk estimates, disturb optimal portfolio selection, and result in unexpected losses. The major investors, portfolio managers, and developers of macroeconomic models like BlackRock, JP Morgan, and the U.S. Fed should use market-based variance to adjust their predictions to the randomness of market trades.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了投资者在不交易投资组合股票的情况下，如何通过观察市场中对其证券的当前交易来估计投资组合的回报、方差和风险。研究发现，市场交易的时间序列可以建模为投资组合的单一证券交易时间序列，从而建立基于市场的证券方差与投资组合方差的等价描述。研究还指出，Markowitz（1952）的方差仅在所有交易量恒定时成立，而市场方差取决于交易量波动的变异系数。通过泰勒展开，研究发现Markowitz方差可能低估或高估市场方差，导致风险估计错误和投资组合选择偏差。
AI.research_question: 如何利用市场交易数据估计不变投资组合的回报、方差和风险？
AI.motivation: 传统Markowitz方差假设交易量恒定，而实际市场中交易量波动显著，可能导致风险估计偏差。本文旨在提出一种基于市场交易量的方差估计方法，以更准确地评估投资组合风险。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于Markowitz（1952）的投资组合理论，引入交易量波动的变异系数，建立市场方差模型。
AI.method: 通过时间序列建模，将市场交易数据转化为投资组合的交易时间序列，并推导市场方差的泰勒展开式。
AI.findings: 市场方差显著依赖于交易量波动的变异系数，Markowitz方差可能低估或高估实际风险。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了基于市场交易量的方差估计方法，扩展了Markowitz的投资组合理论。
AI.practical_contributions: 为投资者、基金经理和宏观经济模型开发者（如BlackRock、JP Morgan、美联储）提供了更准确的风险评估工具。

title: Pensions and Subjective Well-being-A Causal Mediation Analysis for 18 Advanced Countries
affiliations: Algemene Pensioen Groep (APG), Korea Institute of Finance and Corporate Strategy & Policy, APG

detail.title: Pensions and Subjective Well-being-A Causal Mediation Analysis for 18 Advanced Countries
detail.abstract: This study examines how national pension systems affect subjective well-being, emphasizing the mediating role of perceived financial security in old age. Using causal mediation analysis, we compare pay-as-you-go (PAYG) and funded pension structures across 18 advanced economies and individual-level data from 2,241 respondents in 9 European countries. We find that private pension funding enhances well-being by strengthening financial security, while PAYG systems are linked to lower security and reduced well-being-especially in ageing societies where demographic pressures heighten the relevance of pension design. Robustness checks-including fixed effects analysis and WHR covariates-confirm that pension diversity contributes to well-being beyond standard predictors.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了国家养老金制度如何通过老年财务安全感的中介作用影响主观幸福感，比较了18个发达经济体的现收现付制（PAYG）和基金制养老金结构，并分析了9个欧洲国家2241名受访者的数据。研究发现，私人养老金通过增强财务安全感提升幸福感，而PAYG制度则与较低的安全感和幸福感下降相关，尤其是在老龄化社会中。稳健性检验证实了养老金多样性对幸福感的独立贡献。

AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了养老金制度通过财务安全感影响幸福感的中介机制，丰富了主观幸福感和养老金制度的研究。

title: High Yield, Capped Gains: A Conceptual Primer on Covered Call ETFs
affiliations: Independant

detail.title: High Yield, Capped Gains: A Conceptual Primer on Covered Call ETFs

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author declares no conflicts of interest. This paper is for academic and informational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice.
declarations.ethicsApproval: Not applicable. This study does not involve human participants, patients, or case studies requiring ethical approval.
declarations.funderStatement: This research received no funding. All data used are publicly available from ETF issuer websites and financial databases.

detail.abstract: Covered call exchange-traded funds (ETFs) have attracted significant investor interest as a means to enhance portfolio income in low-yield and volatile environments. By systematically writing call options on underlying stock positions, these products generate option premiums that are distributed as income. However, this income comes with structural tradeoffs: upside participation is capped, performance is path dependent, and distributions may include a return of capital (ROC) component that reduces principal over time. This primer offers a comprehensive conceptual framework for understanding the mechanics, risk characteristics, and real-world implementations of covered call ETFs, with a focus on their role in diversified portfolios. We emphasize the tradeoff between yield and growth, the potential illusion created by ROC, and the asymmetry of outcomes across market regimes. Stylized NAV dynamics, strategy comparisons, and real-world ETF data from U.S. and UCITS markets are used to support our analysis. We conclude that while covered call ETFs can serve as incomegenerating complements in conservative portfolios, they are generally unsuitable as long-term growth engines or core equity holdings.

AI.tldr: 本文分析了备兑看涨期权ETF（covered call ETFs）的机制、风险特征及其在多样化投资组合中的作用，指出其在低收益和波动市场中的收入增强潜力，但也强调了其结构性权衡，如上行潜力受限、路径依赖表现以及可能包含资本返还（ROC）成分。

AI.theory_contributions: 提供了备兑看涨期权ETF的全面概念框架，揭示了其收入与增长的权衡及ROC的潜在误导性。

As customary and legally required in this context, all survey respondents are asked for their consent to participate in the interview at the beginning of the survey. detail.abstract: Item nonresponse is a common issue in surveys. We implement an experiment to reduce nonresponse to income questions in an international household survey, looking at four different countries. Survey respondents are asked to report their exact household income. We randomize those who refuse to answer into two groups. In a follow-up question, the control group is asked to choose their income from a very granular list of brackets, the treatment group receives only three options to choose from. In all four countries, the treatment leads to a significant decrease in nonresponse. Thus, when condensed income data are sufficient, fewer answer options are a cost-effective way to reduce nonresponse.

AI.tldr: 通过实验验证，减少收入问题选项数量能显著降低调查中的无应答率。
AI.research_question: 减少收入问题的选项数量是否能降低调查中的无应答率？
AI.motivation: 收入问题在调查中常因敏感或无应答率高而影响数据质量，需探索成本有效的解决方法。

AI.method: 在国际家庭调查中随机将拒绝回答的受访者分为两组：对照组从细粒度选项中选择，实验组从三个选项中选择。
